intro: Heuffelia lucida, commonly known as the shining heuffelia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, white hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in the spring and early summer. Heuffelia lucida thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens and alpine settings. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to gardens that seek both ornamental value and ecological interest.
